Posts.Content: wenmazb wrote: Hi- I had my first round of taxotere on 7/7.  About a week later I started having some typical hand sx's--sore, burnt feeling fingertips and now very itchy with a mild rash on the front and backs.  The skin feels thickened, sensitive and prickly.   Any suggestions on how to manage this?  Would claritin help 2 weeks after tx?  Steriod creams?  I just purchased a set of ice gloves for my next treatment in hopes I can nip this in the bud since I have 3 more to go!  Thanks! Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2009 08:54AM wenmazb wrote: Hi- I was faced with this same decision also.  And like you, I have been very much in denial about neededing chemo.  I am also small--115 lbs, 5'5 and have been fearful of chemo taking my small body out.  I am stage 1, grade 3, triple negative, node negative.  The way my oncologist presented the regimens to me was that if I do AC/T for 8 rounds my risk of recurrance would be between 10-14%.  With 4 cycles of TC it would be between 13-18%, so I chose to do the AC/T.  I had my first treatment on June 16 and did not do well.  I won't get into the details because I hate the effect horror stories have on my psyche, but I did end up in the hospital for two nights last week.  After this experience I didn't want to continue and my oncologist then recommended I switch to 4 rounds of TC every 3 weeks.  So I am going to try this new regimen and see if I can tolerate it better.  Since there is no data comparing these two regimens head to head it is hard to know if it is as effective, but if I can't tolerate the AC, it becomes a non issue.   The other stats that were given to me regarding these regimens was that with AC/T, the chance of mortality in 10 yrs is 8%, and with TC it is 11%.  That's a minimal difference.  So that is my two cents.  I hope you get some clarity today.  I wish there was a magic crystal ball to help guide us through this.  Good luck to you.  Let us know what you decide.
